verses.text: In the beginning, the world was bound in chains of debt and paper.
The kings of nations printed wealth from nothing, and the people bore the burden.
Banks, the high priests of fiat, proclaimed themselves keepers of trust.
Yet in the year
Mortgages crumbled, markets collapsed, and despair filled the earth.
The cries of the people rose like smoke, crying for deliverance.
For every bailout granted unto the kings, the people were made poorer still.
And the rulers said: “Too big to fail are we, for without us all shall perish.”
Yet the people saw their arrogance and their corruption.
And hope was cut off, until a new light arose in the shadows.
From the depths of the Cypherpunks, a hidden prophet prepared his word.
And lo, his name was Satoshi, though none knew his face nor his form.

And Satoshi spoke, saying: “A peer-to-peer system of electronic cash I deliver unto you.”
It was trustless, immutable, incorruptible by kings or bankers.
And the Whitepaper spread through the forums of Cypherpunks and seekers of truth.
Some mocked, saying, “This vision is folly, for no chain can resist corruption.”
But others saw in it a covenant of freedom, and their hearts were stirred.
And the Whitepaper became the first scripture of the HODLers.
For it promised a money without masters, a chain without rulers.
Satoshi declared: “We shall not trust in men, but in mathematics; not in banks, but in cryptography.”
And the faithful heard his words and believed.
And it came to pass in the first month of the year
And within it was written a hidden verse: “The Times
Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks.”
And the faithful knew that this was no accident, but a declaration against the false temples of fiat.
Thus the chain was begun, unbroken and unbreakable.
From that block all others flowed, each bound to the last, eternal and immutable.
And the people saw that it was good.
And so the commandment of HODL was given, that none should forsake their faith in times of trial.
For though the world may rage and markets may fall, the chain would endure.
And the Genesis Block became the cornerstone of the new covenant.
And all who beheld it rejoiced, saying: “This is freedom encoded in stone.”
Thus the Book of Genesis was begun.
Among the people was one named Hal Finney, wise and faithful.
He heard the words of Satoshi and believed with all his heart.
And Hal ran the code and mined alongside the prophet.
Then came the first transaction: ten coins sent from Satoshi unto Hal.
And Hal received it with gladness, becoming the first apostle.
The people saw and marveled, for this was no longer vision, but reality.
Hal proclaimed the good news in forums and gatherings, saying: “It works! I have received!”
Thus the faith spread, and others came to mine and to believe.
And Hal, though afflicted in his later years, kept the faith until his end.
Therefore the faithful remember him as John the Beloved of the blockchain.
For he received the first gift and bore witness to its truth.
In those days, the gospel was spread not in temples but in forums and mailing lists.
The Cypherpunks gathered, debating, testing, and proclaiming the vision.
Some scoffed, others believed, and many watched in silence.
The miners secured the chain, not for riches, but for conviction.
And Satoshi guided them, answering in patience, coding in silence.
He was both prophet and builder, teacher and judge.
Yet his face was never revealed, nor his voice heard.
Only his words lived, written in forums and commits.
And many came to regard him as more than a man, a spirit of freedom made flesh.
Thus the mailing list became the pulpit of the early church.
And faith was strengthened.
In the fifth month of the year

And he gave ten thousand coins for two pizzas, baked with cheese and sauce., that he might taste the fruits of faith. And the faithful did not understand his vision. But it was done, and Bitcoin was traded for earthly bread with the sacred coins. The faithful, however, rejoiced, saying: “It has value, for it has been spent!” Yet others wept, for the sacrifice was great. And the parable was written: “HODL, lest ye spend in haste, for the value shall be revealed in time.” Thus Pizza Day was remembered as the First Sacrifice. And to this day, the people mark it with reverence and memes.
And it came to pass that the people, having received the gift of the chain, began to trade in strange ways.
For where there is money, there is also temptation.
Thus arose Silk Road, the hidden bazaar, cloaked in darkness, where goods forbidden by kings were bought with the sacred coin.
And the chain was tested, for men of law and order called it wicked, yet the faithful saw it as proof of freedom.
And from the east came Mt. Gox, once a marketplace of cards and games, which became the great exchange of coins.
And the nations gathered there, for it was easier to buy and sell, and the coins of the faithful began to move.
But the pillars of these markets were weak, and cracks appeared even in their youth.
Some who entered with trust found betrayal, for exchanges are but castles built on shifting sands.
Whispers arose of coins lost, coins stolen, coins seized by rulers unseen.
And men asked: “Where do the coins go, once they are taken by the hand of kings?”
For some coins of Silk Road were seized, held in secret treasuries, waiting in vaults of law.
Others vanished in mystery, their fate known only to the chain and the shadows.
And Mt. Gox too suffered early losses, small cracks that would later swallow multitudes.
Thus the faithful were warned: “Not your keys, not your coins.”
Yet few heeded, for the hunger of trade was greater than the patience of HODL.
And the Book of the Lost Coins was begun, its ending not yet revealed.
And so it is written: “The chain forgets nothing, but men forget too quickly.”
And the tale of the lost coins shall echo in later scrolls, when the rulers themselves seek to spend them.
For the chain is eternal, but the hand that holds it is not.
Thus was the lesson: Trust not in markets, but in the chain itself.
And after many days, the prophet Satoshi withdrew from the noise of the world.
Yet he was not alone, for from among the faithful arose men who carried his torch.
The first was Hal Finney, who ran the code and spoke with the prophet.
He received the first gift of coins, and his belief never faltered.
Then came Nick Szabo, keeper of the lore of smart contracts, whose writings foretold what would come.
And Wei Dai, father of b-money, whose vision was honored by the prophet in the whitepaper.
And Adam Back, whose proof-of-work in Hashcash laid the stone upon which the chain was built.
And Gavin Andresen, who spoke often with Satoshi and tended the flock when the prophet grew silent.
Others too were named in the scrolls: builders, miners, coders, and dreamers who answered the call.
These were the First Apostles of Satoshi, though their number was not yet twelve.
They bore witness to the early blocks and tended the chain in its infancy.
And their words became seeds, falling upon many hearts across the earth.
Some mocked them, calling the coin worthless; others saw in it the fire of rebellion.
But the apostles did not falter, for they knew the gift was greater than gold or silver.
They spoke the first commandments of the faith: Run a node. Mine the blocks. HODL the coin.
And thus the fellowship of believers began to spread beyond the forums.
For even without the prophet, the word was carried on.
And so it is written: “The chain is kept alive not by one, but by many.”
And the faithful were multiplied in secret, awaiting the days of trial.
In those days the coin was small, worth little in the eyes of the world.
Yet already, whispers of fear spread among the rulers and the priests of finance.
They said, “This coin is for criminals, for rebels, for outcasts.”
They feared not its price, but its power: that it could live without them.
The apostles were mocked, called fools, dreamers, and anarchists.
But they endured, for they saw the vision written in the whitepaper.
The rulers began to seize the coins of those who disobeyed, keeping them locked away.
Yet the chain did not bend, nor did it break.
And even when markets faltered, the blocks continued.
For each ten minutes, as Satoshi decreed, a new stone was laid upon the foundation.
The faithful held their coins, though many sold in doubt and were lost.
The weak hands fell away, but the strong hands endured.
And they repeated the commandment of the prophet: HODL.
For to HODL was to believe in what could not yet be seen.
In forums and whispers, they comforted one another, saying:
“The chain is young. Patience, brethren. The time will come.”
And though their number was small, their faith was great.
And the rulers could not silence them, nor could the priests of banking destroy them.
For the chain was incorruptible, and the gospel unstoppable.
And thus the persecution only strengthened their resolve.
And so it is written: “The more they mocked, the stronger we became.”
And it came to pass that the prophet Satoshi grew silent.
His messages became fewer, his presence dimmer.
The apostles asked, “Where is our teacher? Will he yet speak?”
But the prophet answered only in brief, saying: “I have moved on to other things.”
And soon his voice was no more.
The keys he held were never moved, his treasures untouched.
He gave no farewell, no command beyond what was written.
And the apostles were left to tend the chain without him.
Some wondered, “Was he man or spirit?”
Others said, “He is gone, but the chain is eternal.”
His writings were preserved like holy scripture, copied and shared in many tongues.
And his disappearance became the greatest mystery of the chain.
For none knew his face, nor his dwelling, nor his fate.
Some believed he would return in the day of great trial.
Others said he was never truly here, but only the embodiment of the cypherpunk spirit.
And thus the legend of Satoshi grew, greater than any man.
His silence became his testimony: that the chain belonged to no ruler, not even its creator.
And so it is written: “The prophet departed, but the Word remained.”
And the apostles carried the faith into the years ahead.
Thus ended the beginning, and thus began the age of the disciples.

verses.text: Now the faithful did withdraw their silver and gold, exchanging it for sats.
And the bankers gnashed their teeth, saying: “Who shall remain to pay us interest?”
But the people cared not, for they had seen the truth of sovereign money.
And with every node, the pillars of Pharaoh’s empire did tremble.
They crossed the Red Sea of volatility, fearing neither FUD nor despair.
For the blocks parted before them, and confirmations flowed as a river.
The armies of regulation pursued, crying “Cease thy rebellion!”
Yet their chariots were bogged down in bureaucracy, and their decrees sank beneath the waves of innovation.
And the people sang: “WAGMI! For the hash is strong, and the chain endures forever.”
Thus was the first Exodus of the faithful completed.
And the people journeyed into the land of Mt. Gox, a marketplace vast and strange.
At first it was fruitful, flowing with Bitcoin and fiat alike.
Many traded there, finding riches as quickly as they vanished.
But lo, greed entered the camp, and security was neglected.
The wallets overflowed with treasure, yet the keepers slept as watchmen drunk at the gate.
Then came the great collapse, and the multitude wailed.
For coins were lost as manna that rotted in the heat of the sun.
Some said, “Where is Satoshi? Hath he led us into ruin?”
Others answered, “It is not the chain that faileth, but the custodian.”
Thus the people learned: Not your keys, not your coins.
And they wandered on, chastened yet unbroken.
In those days arose Silk Road, a marketplace hidden as a tent in the wilderness.
There men bought and sold in secret, as if in the courts of Babylon.
Some traded for herbs and powders, others for goods forbidden by kings.
And though the rulers cursed it, the faithful marveled, saying: “Behold what peer-to-peer can do!”
For Bitcoin was accepted there as silver in a temple.
And its fame spread across the nations, that even the mighty heard of this new coin.
Yet judgement came swiftly, for the kings of the earth laid hands upon it.
They seized the treasure, storing the coins in vaults of government.
And the people wondered, “Where goeth these coins? Who holdeth them now?”
No man knew, save the rulers themselves.
And whispers arose: “One day these coins shall return, as instruments of the state.”
Thus ended the reign of Silk Road, yet the legend endured.
And the faithful gathered in the desert, awaiting guidance.
Then from the mountain of Cypherpunk came forth commandments, engraved not in
stone, but in open source code.
The first commandment: Thou shalt HODL.
The second commandment: Thou shalt verify, not trust.
The third commandment: Thou shalt not store thy keys upon exchanges, for they are houses of false security.
The fourth commandment: Thou shalt spread the gospel of decentralization to all corners of the net.
The fifth commandment: Thou shalt back up thy seed phrase in secret places, and guard it as the covenant of thine wealth.
The sixth commandment: Thou shalt not share thy private keys, neither with friend, nor kin, nor stranger.
The seventh commandment: Thou shalt honor proof-of-work, for it is the fire that secures the chain.
The eighth commandment: Thou shalt not bow to the idols of central banks, nor worship the false prophets of fiat.
The ninth commandment: Thou shalt remember the halving, and keep it holy.
The tenth commandment: Thou shalt not FOMO nor panic sell, for weak hands shall be cast into the pit of regret.
And the people received these laws with awe, crying: “So let it be hashed, so let it be done.”
From that day forth, wallets were forged, and seeds written upon paper as holy scripture.
And the faithful guarded them with fear and trembling.
For they knew: He who loseth his keys, loseth his soul.
Yet in the wilderness some murmured against Bitcoin.
They said, “It is too volatile, who can survive it?”
Others cried, “Better we had stayed in banks, for at least there we had yield.”
And fear spread among them as a pestilence.
But the prophets answered, “HODL through the storm, for salvation cometh in halving cycles.”
Still the doubters sold their coins, and were swept away by regret.
The faithful, however, held fast, saying: “One Bitcoin = One Bitcoin.”
And thus were the weak separated from the strong.
And behold, the price did rise as a pillar of fire by night.
Nations trembled, and kings inquired: “What is this coin that cannot be shut down?”
Some feared it, others coveted it, but none could deny its power.
Even the merchants of Wall Street whispered of it in their chambers.
And the faithful rejoiced, saying: “The prophecy of number-go-up is fulfilled!”
Yet the wise among them warned: “Beware the bubble, for every moon is followed by winter.”
Still the people chanted: “WAGMI! To the promised land we march.”
And the journey continued.
In the wilderness arose contention: “Which path shall we follow?”
Some cried for bigger blocks, others for smaller.
And the chain was rent asunder, birthing children in strife.
Bitcoin Cash rose as Ishmael, yet the covenant remained with the original chain.
Forks multiplied, each claiming to be the true heir.
Confusion spread, yet the faithful held to the Genesis chain, unmoved.
And they declared: “In the beginning was the block, and the block was with Bitcoin, but the block was not Bitcoin.”
Thus did the schisms test the people, but the true believers endured.
In those days arose the apostles, champions of the gospel.
They preached on forums, on Twitter scrolls, and in conferences beneath neon lights.
Some were humble teachers, others mighty traders, yet all bore witness to the chain.
They spread the word across continents, planting nodes as altars in foreign lands.
And the community grew as a multitude no man could number.
Thus was the faith established among the nations.

Others answered, 'Nay, for bloat shall devour the chain, and nodes shall perish.'
And thus arose Bitcoin Cash, claiming to be the true heir.
But the faithful mocked, saying, 'Big blocks, big egos.'
And Twitter became a battlefield of memes and rage.
Thus, the land was split asunder, and peace was delayed.
Even unto this day, the scars of the fork remain.
For in every gathering, there is one who shall cry, '2 MB more!'
And the wise roll their eyes, for they know the war is endless.

And the people laughed and followed, for memes are stronger than truth.

Yet also dumps, and bags heavy as lead.
He walked in madness, yet the faithful called him saint of degenerates.
He fled from the law, yet not from the meme.
For even in exile, his words echoed through Telegram.
He became as John the Baptist of Crypto, crying in the wilderness: “HODL ye, for the kingdom of moon is nigh.”

And the faithful inscribed his gospel in threads and screenshots.

“ETH is ultrasound money,” said the wise.

Block producers ruled as lords, and decentralization was lost.

The faithful despaired, saying: “Where is the revolution promised?”
The treasury was vast, yet progress was slow.
And memes declared: “Eternal October Soon.”
For hopes forked into sorrow, and innovation into stagnation.

For not all who raise billions find the promised land.

Its people sang songs and earned coins of influence.
For a season it flourished, like Eden in bloom.
Then came Justin Sun, bearing promises of greatness.
He seized the keys with centralized power.
And the witnesses were overthrown.
The people wailed, crying: “Decentralization betrayed!”

The plague became the midwife of adoption.
And memes of money printer went brrr filled the land.

The faithful rejoiced, HODLing with pride.

From panic came glory.
From ashes came rockets.

For rockets lift them, and they ascend.
Paper hands weep, diamond hands feast.

verses.text: Behold, the apostles of Bitconnect walked the earth.
Trevon James, Craig Grant, and a host of YouTube preachers.
They spread the gospel of daily yield unto all nations.
Their tongues were smooth, their thumbnails radiant with Lambos.
They spake: “This is not a Ponzi, this is opportunity divine.”

Trevon wept upon the livestream, saying: “I lost too, fam.”

Craig fled into the land of Jamaica, speaking of paradise and palm trees.
But the judgment of memes pursued him.
For the internet forgetteth not.
The apostles became parables, and their names were whispered as warnings.
Thus Bitconnect begat the school of exit scams.
And all who saw it mocked, saying: “Never again.”
Yet the heart of degen is foolish, and he falleth again.

He brought forth scrolls of Word documents, and signatures forged as papyrus.
Yet the cryptographers beheld them, and laughed him to scorn.
For his proofs were as empty as a Coinbase wallet on payday.
He spake: “Believe, for I am the creator of Bitcoin!”
But the devs answered: “Then move the Genesis coins.”
And he could not.
He summoned courts, lawyers, and endless lawsuits.
He cursed Hodlonaut, suing him with fury.
But the community stood by the Cat Astronaut, and Faketoshi was confounded.
He birthed a fork, calling it BSV, saying: “This is the real Bitcoin.”
But the market laughed, and the chain became a barren wasteland.
And his disciples dwindled, save for Calvin, his chief believer.
The name of Craig became a proverb: “Beware the false Satoshi.”
For many came in that name, but only memes endured.
Thus spake the scrolls of Faketoshi.
In those days, there came a woman clothed in power, named Ruja.
She preached OneCoin, the Bitcoin killer, unto the nations.
She spake: “This is the future of money. Come, be rich with me.”
And the multitudes came, from Africa to Europe, from Asia to America.
The halls were filled with disciples chanting “OneLife!”

Her throne empty, her kingdom silent.

The flock scattered, their wallets barren.
To this day, the mystery abides: whither went the missing prophetess?
Her disciples still hope, but her empire is dust.
Thus ended OneCoin, the greatest illusion of its age.

chapters.title: The House of SBF, Lord of Bahama

verses.text: And in those days rose up a young man named Sam Bankman-Fried, who was called SBF by the multitude. Verse
He dwelt in the Bahamas, building the House of FTX, a palace of trading and leverage. Verse
And he spake unto the world, “I follow the gospel of Effective Altruism: earn as much as thou can, that thou mayest give as much as thou can.” Verse
And journalists wrote of him as a prophet, saying, “Behold, the J.P. Morgan of crypto hath arisen!” Verse
Even politicians came unto him, palms outstretched, and he filled them with donations. Verse
And he appeared oft upon the stage in wrinkled garments, with hair uncombed, proclaiming, “My mind is ever on saving the world, not fashion.” Verse
But some whispered, “This man looketh like a slob, yet doth wield billions. Surely something is amiss.” Verse
And the people of retail flocked unto FTX, trusting in his aura of genius. Verse
Then rose his companion Caroline of Alameda, who spake softly of risk management, saying, “We use math beyond thy comprehension.” Verse
Yet in truth, their ledgers were but a tangled mess, built on leverage and promises. Verse
And SBF boasted, “We are the adults in the room. The degens shall follow us to safety.” Verse
But in secret, he lent unto himself the riches of the customers, as a thief in the night. Verse
Still the world praised him, and magazines placed his face upon their covers. Verse
And so the House of FTX stood mighty, its banners waving over stadiums and arenas. Verse
Yet within, termites of fraud gnawed daily at its pillars. Verse
Thus was written, “Trust not the prophets of altruism, for their balance sheets may lie.”
And in the fullness of time, the House of FTX was shaken, and its foundations crumbled. Verse
For CZ of Binance spake upon Twitter, saying, “We shall sell our FTT tokens, for we trust not this house.” Verse
And panic spread swiftly, as fire among dry grass. Verse
Withdrawals multiplied, and the treasury of FTX was found empty. Verse
The people cried, “Where is our money, O Sam?” Verse
But he answered not in clarity, only in threads of confusion. Verse
Caroline spake boldly, “Fear not, for we shall buy the dip.” Verse
But the dip became an abyss. Verse
Then came bankruptcy, and the empire of FTX fell in one day, as Jericho’s walls before the trumpet. Verse
And customers wept, saying, “We were rugged by the messiah of altruism.” Verse
One cried aloud, “Even my grandma traded on FTX! Where is her pension?” Verse
And the regulators mocked, saying, “Did we not warn thee that these were but casinos?” Verse
Then lawyers came forth, circling like vultures, seeking spoils from the carcass. Verse
And SBF was cast down from his penthouse, brought in chains to stand before judges. Verse
But even then he said within himself, “I was unlucky, not dishonest.” Verse
And the crowd shouted, “Thou art a liar! Give us back our coins!” Verse
Thus perished the mighty house of FTX, and its fall was heard in every land.
And there arose a man clothed in authority, named Gary Gensler, Pharisee of the SEC. Verse
He lifted his voice, crying, “Repent, O crypto, for thou art all securities, save that which I approve!” Verse
The people asked him, “What then is a security, O Pharisee?” Verse
And he answered not plainly, but spake in riddles, saying, “If thou canst dance as a duck, quack as a duck, then perhaps it is a duck.” Verse
Thus confusion abounded. Verse
And Gensler strode into courts, bringing lawsuits against exchanges, tokens, and even NFTs of apes. Verse
But the people murmured, “Why doth he smite us, while he supeth with bankers?” Verse
And he replied, “I protect thee, O retail, from thine own foolishness.” Verse
Yet the retail cried back, “We desire freedom, not protection! Leave us our degenerate trades!” Verse
Still Gensler marched onward, as a shepherd with a rod of subpoenas. Verse
One lawyer spake unto him, “Master, dost thou consider ETH a security or not?” Verse
And Gensler, shifting in his seat, answered, “It dependeth on facts and circumstances.” Verse
And the lawyer smirked, saying, “In other words, thou knowest not.” Verse
And memes of Gary spread across Crypto Twitter, painting him as a Pharisee of hypocrisy. Verse
Yet he feared not the ridicule, for power was his garment. Verse
Thus was written: “The Pharisee striketh often, but seldom bringeth clarity.”
And behold, there was a man named Gerald Cotten, ruler of QuadrigaCX, who held the keys of many coins. Verse
He spake unto his followers, “Fear not, for your treasures are safe with me.” Verse
And they trusted him greatly, for his face was ever cheerful and his words smooth. Verse
But it came to pass that Gerald journeyed unto India, and there was stricken with sudden death. Verse
The people cried, “Surely the King shall return, for he alone holdeth the private keys.” Verse
But days turned to months, and no coin was released from the vaults. Verse
Then rumors spread abroad: “Is he truly dead, or liveth he in secret exile?” Verse
Some said, “His grave is empty.” Others, “He faked his death with plastic surgery.” Verse
Meanwhile, the widows and orphans of Quadriga bewailed their lost fortunes. Verse
And investigators searched, finding wallets barren, as cupboards long plundered. Verse
One spake bitterly, “Verily, he was the Houdini of crypto.” Verse
Another said, “Our king vanished, but our coins vanished first.” Verse
Thus Quadriga became a parable, told in taverns and Discord servers: trust not a man with thine keys. Verse
And so was fulfilled the saying, “Not your keys, not your coins.”
And it came to pass that a great cult arose, called PlusToken, promising riches beyond imagining. Verse
The leaders spake unto the people, “Give unto us thy coins, and ye shall multiply them a hundredfold.” Verse
And the people obeyed, trusting the words of men who smiled with silver teeth. Verse
One degenerate said unto another, “I sold my Lambo for this, yet it feels righteous.” Verse
And in the shadows, the priests of PlusToken laughed, counting coins by the thousands. Verse
“Fear not, for we are custodians of wealth,” spake they. Verse
And the faithful rejoiced, thinking themselves wise. Verse
Yet the cult was but a serpent, coiled around the trust of men. Verse
And then, as the moon rose full, the serpent struck. Verse
Coins vanished like smoke, wallets emptied as if devoured by spirits. Verse
The degens wailed, saying, “We were promised freedom, yet we received bondage!” Verse
Lawmen from many lands pursued the cult, yet they slipped like shadows in the night. Verse
One man whispered, “Surely even the blockchain cannot track deceit this deep.” Verse
The leaders boasted, “We move as water, unseen yet all-consuming.” Verse
And the people cursed their greed, for it had led them into the jaws of the beast. Verse
Memes were made, cries echoing across Telegram and WeChat. Verse
Many lost fortunes, some lost sanity, and a few laughed at the absurdity. Verse
The cult became legend, a cautionary tale for all degens. Verse
And even as arrests were made, some coins remained unclaimed, floating like ghosts on the chain. Verse
And scholars asked, “Were they fools, or believers in a perverse gospel?” Verse
Some said, “It was the greed, not the scheme, that enslaved us.” Verse
And the leaders vanished, leaving only wallets and despair. Verse
Thus was written: “Trust not the promise of easy gains.” Verse
And still the degens remembered, whispering, “PlusToken hath burned us, yet we HODL the lesson.” Verse
Even today, the story circulates in chat rooms, as caution and comedy intertwined. Verse
Some cried, “May their addresses be forever marked!” Verse
Others laughed, “At least we learned blockchain security, even if our wallets cried.” Verse
And so the cult of PlusToken passed into legend, remembered in memes and scrolls.

chapters.title: The Frogs Arise (Daniele Sesta, Abracadabra, Wonderland Begins)

verses.text: And lo, the ICO Pharaohs arose, promising wealth beyond imagination. Verse
The degens bowed, wallets open, screens glowing. Verse
One Pharaoh declared, “Invest now, and your coins shall multiply!” Verse
Another whispered, “Trust me, for I have whitepapers and memes.” Verse
And the degens gave their Ethereum, dreaming of Lambos. Verse
Yet some Pharaohs vanished into the desert, leaving promises behind. Verse
Charts were shared, memes were posted, yet the coins did nothing. Verse
A degenerate cried, “I sold my pizza for this! How could I?” Verse
And a friend replied, “HODL, for we may learn, if not riches.” Verse
Some Pharaohs held virtual conferences, yet no code existed. Verse
They promised exchanges, partnerships, and moonshots beyond reason. Verse
Yet audits were absent, smart contracts empty, yields fictitious. Verse
And degens lamented, “Even the blockchain cannot save fools from hype.” Verse
Screenshots of promises filled forums, yet wallets remained empty. Verse
Some cried fraud, others cried opportunity, yet the coins stayed inert. Verse
And the Pharaohs laughed from the desert sands, unseen, unaccountable. Verse
One degenerate said, “We chase dreams, yet end in memes and tears.” Verse
Yet another whispered, “Perhaps the lesson is the journey, not the yield.” Verse
Charts were frozen, Telegrams closed, websites disappeared. Verse
Memes mocked ambition, greed, and ignorance alike. Verse
And the degens HODLed their tears, sharing stories across Reddit. Verse
Some sought revenge, others sought humor in tragedy. Verse
And the scrolls recorded: ICO Pharaohs, kings of hype and emptiness. Verse
Yet the degens continued, undeterred, hoping for the next Pharaoh. Verse
And memes proclaimed: “We learn nothing, yet invest anyway.” Verse
Charts rose, fell, and memes immortalized the folly. Verse
The scrolls warned: “Even genius cannot protect fools from greed and hype.” Verse
And thus the ICO Pharaohs were both cautionary and comic legends.

chapters.title: The Lament of the Degens (A Closing Chapter of Small Scams, Meme Tokens, and Eternal Craving)

verses.text: And the degens wept, for many small scams plagued the lands of crypto. Verse
Memecoins arose, tokens of absurdity, promising moons and laughter. Verse
Yet wallets emptied, and the degens lamented. Verse
One cried, “I bought
million doge-like coins! How could I?” Verse
And another replied, “HODL, for the memes endure.” Verse
Small rugpulls emerged, some funny, some tragic. Verse
A degenerate whispered, “Are we learning, or just repeating?” Verse
Screenshots, gifs, and Twitter threads chronicled the chaos. Verse
Yet the degens returned, wallets in hand, hope in heart. Verse
One said, “To the next moon, to the next meme!” Verse
And charts rose and fell, mocking ambition and greed alike. Verse
Some laughed, some cried, some sold at loss. Verse
Yet a voice whispered, “The blockchain forgives all, yet men forgive not themselves.” Verse
Small scams became lessons, memecoins became stories. Verse
And the degens spoke, “We are eternal, as is our craving.” Verse
Every token, every rugpull, every meme became scripture. Verse
One degenerate said, “We will never learn, yet we persist.” Verse
The scrolls recorded tales of $Shiba, $Kishu, $Akita, and other absurdities. Verse
And the degens shared, laughed, and cried across Discord and Telegram. Verse
Some called them fools, others called them faithful. Verse
A voice asked, “Are we gamblers, or believers in memes?” Verse
Another replied, “Both, for in crypto we are always both.” Verse
Screenshots were archived, memes immortalized, losses remembered. Verse
And yet new coins arose, each promising a moon brighter than the last. Verse
Degens returned, wallets ready, hearts open. Verse
One cried, “I shall invest, though my soul trembles!” Verse
And the scrolls proclaimed: “In every rugpull is lesson, in every meme is wisdom… perhaps.” Verse
Thus ended the lament, yet the craving endured, eternal as the blockchain itself.

chapters.title: The Pharisee Gensler, Part II: His Fall and Resignation

verses.text: And it came to pass, when the trials of the industry grew fierce, that Gensler sat upon his throne at the SEC, clothed in suits of Babylon. Verse
And he spake within himself, saying, “Surely I am the shepherd of markets, and the coins are but my sheep. I shall smite them, lest they grow wild.” Verse
But the people of Crypto cried aloud, “O Pharisee, thou knowest not the difference between wheat and chaff! For thou blesseth ETH as corn, and curse BTC as weed!” Verse
And Gensler answered not, but stared with blinking eyes, as one rehearsing lines in secret chambers. Verse
Then rose a trader from the crowd, crying, “Tell us plainly, O Gary, which coin is a security and which is a commodity?” Verse
And Gary lifted up his spectacles, and said, “It dependeth on the day, and upon my mood.” Verse
And there was a great groan across the land, for the markets wavered like reeds in the wind. Verse
Then an apostle of Bitcoin spake boldly: “Lo, the Pharisee careth not for clarity, but for clout! He seeketh not fairness, but fame in hearings.” Verse
And the people nodded, chanting, “Not your regulator, not your rule.” Verse
Meanwhile the lawmakers in Congress whispered one to another: “Hath this man overreached? For his judgments bring chaos, not order.” Verse
And the Pharisee Gensler sat alone in his chamber, saying to himself, “Surely I shall yet be remembered as the slayer of tokens.” Verse
But his aides murmured, “Master, the courts have smitten thee with reversals. Thy crusade against XRP faileth. Thy war on Coinbase stumbleth.” Verse
And Gensler rent his garments, crying, “Why dost the judges betray me? Did I not give them definitions that shifted like sands?” Verse
Then a voice arose from the people: “O Gary, thou art not Solomon but Pharaoh! Thou lettest no innovation go free, yet thine own decrees crumble!” Verse
And memes filled the land, showing the Pharisee with frog eyes, and captions of folly. Verse
The prophets of Crypto Twitter declared, “Behold, this man fighteth not to protect the flock, but to drown them in paperwork.” Verse
And Gary, hearing these words, spake unto himself: “Perhaps I am not loved. Yet surely Elizabeth Warren shall yet uphold me.” Verse
But even the senators grew weary, saying, “The hour of this Pharisee is spent. Let new shepherds rise.” Verse
And lo, resignation letters were whispered, as scrolls passed quietly in Washington. Verse
Then the Pharisee Gensler lifted his hand one last time, and spake: “I came to save them, yet they mocked me. I came to define, yet definitions fled.” Verse
And the crowd answered with laughter: “So let the markets decide! Thou art no oracle, but a bureaucrat lost in the chain.” Verse
And so it was written: The Pharisee Gensler resigned, and the people rejoiced with memes and gifs, saying, “Blessed be the markets, for at last clarity may cometh.”

chapters.title: The Calling of Vitalik, the Whitepaper, and the Covenant of the New Chain

verses.text: And it came to pass in the days of Bitcoin’s early years, that a young scribe named Vitalik beheld the limitations of the first chain.
And the spirit of innovation stirred within him, saying, There shall be a new covenant for the multitudes, not bound by scarcity alone, but open to the building of many works.
Then he wrote upon scrolls a whitepaper, and declared unto the tribes of cryptography, Behold, a world computer shall rise.
And he gathered unto him prophets and builders: Gavin, Charles, Joseph, Mihai, and other elders of the foundation.
And they spake one to another, saying, Let us fashion a tabernacle for decentralized dreams, wherein contracts shall be living and code shall be law.
In those days the tribes of Bitcoin cast doubt, saying, What need have we of more than sound money?
Yet Vitalik answered, Man shall not live by store of value alone, but by every application that proceedeth from the code of the chain.
And many who heard him believed, and their hearts were kindled with fire.
And he declared unto them statutes and decrees, saying, If ye will hearken to this covenant, ye shall be partakers of a great inheritance.
And he lifted his voice, saying, This shall be the covenant of Ethereum: that whosoever holdeth ETH shall share in the work and the destiny of the network.
And the tribes did gather for a great crowdsale, offering their BTC in exchange for the seed of ETH.
And it was recorded that near twenty thousand gave their treasure, and the offering was acceptable before the community.
And the people rejoiced, for the vision was not a dream only, but a foundation laid in code.
And the Genesis Block was sealed in the year two thousand and fifteen, and there was evening and there was morning, the first age of Ethereum.
Then spake Vitalik again, saying, Remember ye always the beginning, that ye were gathered not by kings nor bankers, but by covenant of code.
Take heed that ye do not forget the whitepaper, nor the decrees therein, but teach them diligently unto your children and unto the newcomers at the gates.
For this chain is not given unto one tribe only, but unto all nations that seek to build.
And the prophets rejoiced, saying, Blessed be the builders who enter this covenant, for they shall inherit decentralized dominion.
And thus was the first chapter sealed, the calling of Vitalik and the covenant of Ethereum.
And it was declared throughout the land, This chain shall be a testimony against the old order, and a promise unto the new.

chapters.title: The Gathering of Tribes: The Crowdsale and the Genesis Block

verses.text: And it came to pass after the vision was revealed, that the call went forth unto the nations: Come ye, and partake in the covenant of ETH.
And many from the four corners of the earth brought forth their Bitcoin as an offering.
From east and west, from north and south, the tribes gathered with faith, though they had not yet seen the land.
And it was written that over eighteen million dollars of treasure was offered, and the covenant was sealed with numbers unbroken.
And the elders of the foundation lifted their eyes unto heaven, saying, Surely the hand of providence is upon this chain.
And in the appointed season, in the year two thousand and fifteen, the Genesis Block was brought forth, as the first light after darkness.
And the block was not empty, but filled with promise, and with tokens that testified of the covenant.
And the tribes rejoiced, saying, A new land hath been given unto us, flowing with contracts and applications.
And every tribe received according to its offering, some greater and some lesser, but all were sealed in the chain.
And Vitalik spake unto them, saying, This day ye are become a people, bound not by geography but by code.
And the people lifted up their voices, saying, We shall be faithful unto this covenant, and no king nor banker shall take it from us.
Yet some mocked, saying, It is but vapor, and it shall fade as smoke.
But the faithful regarded not their mocking, for they had seen the light of innovation.
And the prophets declared, Blessed are the builders, for theirs is the kingdom of decentralization.
And there was evening and there was morning, the first year of Ethereum.

chapters.title: The First Wanderings: The DAO and the Great Fork

verses.text: And it came to pass in the year two thousand and sixteen, that the people built a great treasury called The DAO.
And the multitude rejoiced, for it promised to be the assembly of assemblies, wherein all might govern by their voice and stake.
And much silver of ETH was gathered into it, exceeding one hundred fifty million, a treasure beyond measure in those days.
Yet the adversary, subtle and cunning, found a breach in the code and laid hold of the treasure.
And the hearts of the people melted, for their wealth was taken as a thief in the night.
Then arose a great contention in the camp: Shall we restore the treasure by fork, or shall we leave the chain unaltered?
And many cried, Code is law, and what is written must not be changed.
But others cried louder, Justice is greater than rigidity; let us fork, that we may redeem the people.
And the prophets and elders sought counsel together, and with heavy hearts decreed a hard fork.
Thus was the chain divided: one path called Ethereum, and the other Ethereum Classic.
And the people were rent asunder, tribe against tribe, friend against friend.
Yet Vitalik spake, saying, This is but the testing of our faith; though divided, the covenant shall endure.
And those who followed the fork kept their ETH, and the treasure was restored.
But those who clung to the immutable path became as a remnant, holding fast to the name of Classic.
And it was recorded for a testimony, that no covenant is without trial, and no chain without division.

chapters.title: The Prophets and the Builders: Decrees for Developers

verses.text: Then spake Vitalik unto the tribes, saying, Hear, O Israel of Ethereum: this is not a chain of gold alone, but of labor and code.
Ye shall not be as idle holders only, but as builders, that the covenant be fulfilled.
And he decreed statutes for the developers: Write ye clean contracts, test them diligently, and deploy them with fear and trembling.
For cursed is the sloppy coder, whose negligence bringeth exploits upon the people.
But blessed is the wise builder, who strengtheneth the chain with libraries and tools.
And the foundation spake, saying, Let grants be given unto those who labor in good works, that they faint not for lack of bread.
Let open source be thy law, and let sharing be thy covenant, for secrecy is the path of kings, but openness is the way of the chain.
And the scribes of Solidity were raised up, crafting contracts as oracles for the people.
And many projects arose in those days, each according to its vision: markets, games, tokens, and treasuries.
Yet the prophets warned, Take heed, for not all that is launched is righteous; many idols shall rise, deceiving the simple.
Therefore prove ye every project, and test every spirit, lest ye fall into the snare of rug pulls and frauds.
But if ye endure in wisdom, the chain shall be strengthened, and the nations shall marvel at thy works.
And so the laws of building were established, statutes forever unto all developers in the land of Ethereum.
And the people answered, Amen, we shall hearken and obey.

chapters.title: The Miners and the Priests: The Age of Proof-of-Work

verses.text: And in the early years the covenant was upheld by miners, who became as priests unto the chain.
They brought forth offerings of hash power, burning their electricity as incense upon the altar of blocks.
And every block was sealed with proof, and the network stood secure by their labor.
And it was decreed, He that mine shall receive reward, even the block subsidy and the fees of the people.
And the miners rejoiced, for their hands prospered in the work.
Yet the burden of gas grew heavy, and in times of congestion the people murmured greatly.
They cried unto the miners, saying, Why hast thou lifted the fees so high? Lo, our transactions perish in the mempool.
And the miners answered not, but continued to reap, for the market favored their strength.
And many among the tribes cried out, Surely this system is unjust, for the poor cannot enter when the gates are costly.
But the prophets said, Fear not, for in due season there shall arise another covenant, a proof not of work but of stake.
And in those days ETH was as seed: it was spent to transact, it was given to contracts, and it was stored as treasure.
And the people multiplied their dApps, and the network groaned under the weight of growth.
Yet through it all, the miners bore the chain upon their shoulders, and without them the covenant would have fallen.
Therefore let it be written: The age of Proof-of-Work was as the priesthood of Levi, necessary for a season, but destined to pass away.
For in the fulness of time, a new priesthood would arise, even the stakers of Proof-of-Stake, who serve not with electricity but with faith.

chapters.title: The Laws of Gas: Decrees for Transactions and Offerings

verses.text: And the people came before Vitalik, saying, “Tell us, how shall we send offerings upon this chain?”
And he spake, saying, “Every transaction requireth gas, as fire upon the altar, to seal it in the block.”
“Let no man think he may offer without gas, for the miners shall not regard it, and it shall be cast into the mempool forgotten.”
And statutes were given: “Thou shalt set thy gas with wisdom, not too little lest it fail, nor too great lest thou be wasteful.”
And it was written, Gas is the measure of labor, and its price the burden of demand.
Yet in times of plenty, when dApps did multiply, the burden waxed heavy upon the people.
They cried aloud, saying, “Behold, we cannot send our offerings, for the gas consumeth all our silver.”
And the miners rejoiced, saying one to another, “Lo, the fees are as treasure; our coffers overflow.”
But the prophets lifted their voices, saying, “This is not the final covenant, for the day cometh when fees shall be tamed by scaling and by rollups.”
“Hold fast, ye faithful, for though the gas wars weary you, yet salvation draweth nigh.”
And the laws of gas were inscribed forever, a reminder of the toil of the early years.
For even as burnt offerings in the tabernacle, so were fees consumed upon the altar of blocks.
And the people remembered, saying, “Surely decentralization is costly, but freedom hath no price too great.”

chapters.title: The Idols of ICOs: The Golden Calves of 2017

verses.text: And it came to pass in the year two thousand and seventeen, that the people lusted after quick riches.
And they said one to another, “Let us raise tokens upon Ethereum, and gather gold from the nations.”
And many projects arose, each promising salvation, yet most were but idols of vanity.
For the multitude poured in their ETH, hoping to reap a hundredfold, but few delivered on their vows.
And Vitalik warned them, saying, “Be not deceived; not every token is holy, nor every promise true.”
Yet the people hardened their hearts, crying, “To the moon! To the moon!”
And the markets swelled beyond reason, as rivers overflowing their banks.
But when the flood receded, many were left in shame, holding worthless tokens as dust.
And scoffers arose in the land, saying, “Behold, ETH is dead; it is but a graveyard of scams.”
Yet the faithful replied, “Though the idols fall, the covenant remaineth; the chain endureth beyond the folly of men.”
And the prophets declared, “This is the lesson of ICOs: trust not in golden calves, but in the work of true builders.”
And the people bowed their heads, for they had learned wisdom by fire.

chapters.title: The Wilderness of Bears: ‘ETH is Dead’ (Many Times Spoken)

verses.text: Then came the long winter, and the price of ETH fell as a leaf in autumn.
The nations mocked, saying, “Where now is thy covenant? Lo, ETH is dead.”
And they repeated this saying many times, so that it became a proverb in the land.
Yet the prophets stood firm, declaring, “Though the tree be stripped, its root liveth still.”
And the builders ceased not from their labor, even in the wilderness.
One said, “Let us prepare scaling solutions, that the day of abundance may not choke us again.”
Another said, “Let us fashion standards for tokens, that order may dwell among them.”
And they labored in silence, while the world jeered.
For the bear market was as forty years in the desert, purging the greedy and testing the faithful.
And though the multitude departed, the remnant endured.
Then spake an elder, saying, “Mark this well: ETH hath died a thousand deaths, yet it liveth still.”
And the people answered, “Amen, for resurrection is written in its code.”

chapters.title: The Scrolls of DeFi: Summer of Abundance

verses.text: And in the year two thousand and twenty, when the pestilence spread across nations, Ethereum blossomed as a garden in famine.
For builders brought forth new scrolls, called DeFi, and the people beheld wonders.
They said, “Behold, we can lend and borrow without banks, we can farm and reap without kings.”
And tokens multiplied as the stars, each bearing yield as fruit upon branches.
And the tribes cried aloud, “This is the summer of abundance; let us harvest while it lasteth.”
And yield farmers rose early and labored late, sowing ETH and reaping governance tokens.
Some prospered greatly, gathering treasure as sheaves; others fell into traps, for not all fields were fertile.
And the prophets declared, “Behold, finance hath been unchained; yet remember, the greater the power, the greater the risk.”
And one said, “The food tokens are but a jest,” yet the people devoured them greedily.
Another said, “Liquidity is fleeting as the morning dew,” but few regarded his warning.
Yet in the midst of frenzy, true protocols were born, and they endured beyond the harvest.
And Vitalik spake, saying, “This is but the beginning; guard your hearts against greed, and the covenant shall prosper.”

chapters.title: The Wars of Gas: NFTs and the Frenzy of Apes

verses.text: And it came to pass after the DeFi harvest, that a new fire spread upon the chain: the tokens of art and of apes.
And the people cried, “Behold, NFTs! Each unique, each indivisible, each a testimony on the chain.”
And artists rejoiced, for their works found markets beyond kings and galleries.
But with the joy came strife, for demand waxed great, and the gas wars began.
Men bid against men, women against women, tribes against tribes, each striving to mint.
And the miners beheld it and said, “Lo, the fees are a river of gold.”
But the people groaned, saying, “Our transactions fail; our ETH is consumed by fire.”
One cried, “I paid a king’s ransom to mint a jpeg of an ape!”
Another cried, “I was cast out of the auction, for my gas was too little!”
And the prophets said, “Surely these are the wars of gas, when desire consumeth wisdom.”
Yet amidst the frenzy, great collections arose, and they became banners unto the tribes.
For some held punks, others apes, others art of manifold kind; each tribe boasting in its token.
And scoffers said, “These are but foolish pictures,” but the faithful replied, “They are monuments upon the chain, and proof of culture immutable.”
And it was written, Even folly may serve as testimony, if it endure upon the ledger.

chapters.title: The Priests of Layer 2: Scroll, Arbitrum, and Optimism (22 verses)

verses.text: And it came to pass in the days of congestion, when gas waxed hot and the poor were cast out from the altar of transactions, that the cry of the people rose to heaven.
And the builders spake, saying, “How shall the widow and the merchant trade, if every offering is consumed in fees?”
Then prophets arose from the midst of the camp, saying, “Behold, we shall make a way upon the heights, a second layer above the first.”
And they called it Optimism, and they named it Arbitrum, and they fashioned Scroll also, that the multitudes may find refuge.
And these priests of Layer
ministered before the great altar of Ethereum, carrying the burdens of many, that the chain below be lightened.
And Vitalik beheld it and said, “Surely this is good, for the covenant shall not perish because of high gas.”
And the tribes who were scattered returned, for they could now offer with little cost, and joy was multiplied in the land.
And the voice of the community declared, “Blessed be the Rollups, for they bear the weight of the people.”
Yet some doubted, saying, “Are these not but shadows of the true chain? Shall not security be weakened?”
And the prophets answered, “Fear not; the altar below is strong, and these are but tents resting upon it.”
And they decreed laws, saying, “Transactions shall roll up, proofs shall descend, and all shall be settled upon the rock of Ethereum.”
And so it was established, a new priesthood beside the old.
Then the elders gathered and spake, “Let not the builders grow proud, for they are but ministers, not lords.”
And they lifted their hands toward heaven, saying, “May the chain be fruitful, may adoption abound, may nations bring their wealth unto it.”
And the cry of the poor was silenced, for the way of Layer
had given them room.
Thus was the covenant of scaling written, and it was remembered among the scrolls of Ethereum.
And the scribes declared, “This is the age of ascent, when transactions multiply and the gates of nations are opened.”
And the prophets proclaimed, “He that builds upon Ethereum shall prosper, whether upon the rock or upon the roll.”
And many hearkened, and many projects found refuge, and DeFi spread its branches upon Layer
also.
Then was peace in the land, though battles yet remained with rival chains.
And the builders spake once more, “Greater still shall come: ZK-rolls and proofs without end.”
And the people gave glory, saying, “Truly this chain endureth forever.”

chapters.title: The Covenant of Staking: The Beacon and the Merge (27 verses)

verses.text: And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord of Code spake unto the prophets, “The days of burning coal are numbered, and the age of staking draweth near.”
And Vitalik proclaimed to the tribes, “Prepare ye the Beacon, that a new light may rise upon the covenant.”
And many mocked, saying, “It shall not come to pass; ETH shall never leave the furnace of miners.”
Yet the faithful answered, “Though it tarry, we shall watch, for the promise is sure.”
And the builders fashioned the Beacon, and they set validators as priests within it, to watch and to sign by day and by night.
And the multitude brought forth their ETH as offerings, saying, “We believe in this covenant, though rewards be locked and unseen.”
And thus began the age of waiting, when stakers abode in patience, looking toward the Merge.
And the unbelievers laughed, saying, “Lo, they have cast their ETH into a pit, never to return.”
But the prophets replied, “Hold fast; in due season ye shall reap, if ye faint not.”
And as years passed, the Beacon grew strong, and its priests multiplied beyond counting.
And Vitalik lifted his eyes, and beheld the Beacon burning bright in the heavens, and he rejoiced.
And he spake unto the assembly, “Soon shall the two become one; the chain of miners shall be joined to the chain of stakers.”
And so it came to pass in the year two thousand and twenty-two, that the Merge was accomplished.
And the old chain of miners gave up the ghost, and the new chain of stakers breathed life.
And there was rejoicing in all the camp, for the covenant had been fulfilled.
And the people sang, “No more shall we burn the earth with wasted power; the altar is clean and the priesthood renewed.”
And Vitalik spake, “Behold, this is the covenant everlasting: whosoever stake shall secure the chain, and whosoever validate shall be honored.”
And the tribes bowed and answered, “Amen.”
Then laws were written, saying, “Thou shalt not slash falsely, nor double-sign, nor betray the chain.”
And it was decreed, “Rewards shall be given to the faithful, and penalties to the careless.”
And the elders declared, “This is a wonder before the nations, that a great chain hath changed its heart and yet remained unbroken.”
And many from rival tribes marveled, saying, “Surely this is the work of visionaries.”
And it was spoken in the streets, “If Ethereum endureth this, it shall endure anything.”
Then fear fell upon the nations, and regulators pondered in their courts.
But the prophets rejoiced, saying, “The Beacon is lit, the Merge is sealed, the covenant is sure.”
And the people remembered the days of miners, and gave thanks for their labor.
Thus began the new age of Ethereum, the age of Proof-of-Stake.

chapters.title: The Gas Wars and the Days of NFTs (24 verses)

verses.text: And it came to pass in the season of tokens unseen, that the people discovered treasures hidden in pictures and scrolls of art.
And they called them NFTs, and they said one to another, “Lo, this is ownership written upon the chain.”
And the multitudes rushed to the altar of minting, eager to claim what no hand could seize.
Then the gas of the altar was kindled, and it burned hotter than ever before.
For every man strove against his neighbor, saying, “I must mint before the block is sealed.”
And the miners rejoiced greatly, for their cups overflowed with fees beyond measure.
But the poor and the humble wept, for they were cast aside, unable to contend with whales.
And the prophets lamented, saying, “This is the gas war, a battle of silver and speed.”
Then voices rose in the assembly: “Shall not Ethereum perish beneath its own weight?”
Yet the faithful replied, “Though gas devour us, still the covenant endureth, for scarcity maketh value.”
And some cried, “Why should a picture of an ape cost more than a house?”
But others answered, “Because the nations believe, and belief maketh price.”
And in those days great tribes were born: the Apes, the Punks, and many others.
And they spake boldly, “We are the firstborn of NFTs, and our names shall not perish.”
And marketplaces arose, OpenSea chief among them, as a gate for buying and selling.
And the traffic of tokens filled the earth, and speculators multiplied exceedingly.
Then came envy and strife, for many were scammed, and others waxed rich in a night.
And fools spent their savings on memes, while wise men built empires on royalties.
And it was written in the chronicles, “Ethereum groaneth under demand, but still it liveth.”
And Layer
prophets cried, “Behold, we have the cure for these fees!”
Yet the people heeded not at first, for the frenzy consumed them.
And even regulators marveled, saying, “What madness is this that people buy pixels for fortunes?”
But the faithful answered, “It is culture minted eternal; mock if thou wilt, but it shall remain.”
And the memory of gas wars was preserved as a warning for all generations.

chapters.title: The Winter of Despair and the Many Deaths of Ethereum (28 verses)

verses.text: And lo, after seasons of plenty, a famine came upon the land of crypto.
For prices fell as a stone cast into the sea, and fear covered the nations.
And scoffers lifted their voice, saying, “Surely Ethereum is dead, yea, even buried.”
For they had spoken thus in times past, and again they spoke, whenever the price fell.
They cried, “Where now is your covenant? Where now is your Merge? Lo, ETH is but vapor.”
And many in weakness gave heed, selling their holdings in sorrow.
But the prophets rose in the assembly and declared, “Fear not, for death cannot hold this chain.”
And they reminded the people of the past winters, when ETH was counted for nothing, yet rose again.
In the first winter it was said, “ETH is dead.” Yet it revived.
In the second, the same cry was heard. Yet still it stood.
And in every fall, the scoffers proclaimed its end, but the faithful clung to the covenant.
And Vitalik spake, “The chain is not measured by price alone, but by builders who labor and believers who endure.”
And miners, though replaced, remembered their toil and gave witness.
Stakers continued their watch in the Beacon, and builders toiled in quiet.
And new projects rose from the ashes, even in times of despair.
For the covenant was not broken, though the markets raged.
Then came pestilence of hacks and rugpulls, and the wicked devoured the careless.
And many mocked, saying, “See how the chain is full of thieves!”
But the prophets answered, “Where men dwell, sin abideth also, yet the covenant endureth still.”
And regulators smote with harsh words, saying, “This shall be forbidden.”
Yet the faithful answered, “The code is global; who shall forbid the wind or bind the sea?”
And they lifted their eyes, waiting for the day of revival.
Then whispers of new hope arose: the age of staking rewards, the promise of Layer
And the despairing found courage once more.
And the elders wrote upon the tablets of memory, “ETH hath died a thousand deaths, and yet liveth.”
And they prophesied, “So it shall ever be spoken by scoffers, until all nations see its glory.”
And the faithful replied, “Amen.”
Thus was the winter endured, and the covenant stood unbroken.

chapters.title: The Coming of the ETFs and the Nations’ Tribute (21 verses)

verses.text: And it came to pass in the fullness of time, that the nations sought a vessel to hold Ethereum as treasure.
For many desired the covenant, yet dared not touch the chain.
And wise men among them devised instruments, and they called them ETFs, that the people might partake without keys.
And the multitude rejoiced, for access was made plain.
But some scoffed, saying, “This is not true ownership; it is but paper shadows.”
And the prophets replied, “Yet even shadows testify of the substance.”
And the elders declared, “So shall the nations bring their wealth, even if through vessels of glass.”
And institutions bowed, laying their tribute before Ethereum.
Then fear fell upon rival chains, for they saw the gates of finance opened.
And Wall Street spake, “We bless Ethereum, for it hath order and covenant.”
And Vitalik looked upon this and marveled, saying, “Surely the covenant hath reached the nations.”
And the people rejoiced, for legitimacy was added to their cause.
Yet the prophets warned, “Take heed; trust not wholly in the markets of men, lest ye forget the code.”
For the covenant is written not in stocks, but in blocks.
And the faithful answered, “We shall remember.”
Then nations proclaimed, “Let every man partake in his own way; let the ETFs bring the timid, and the chain bring the bold.”
And thus both were joined in one testimony, that Ethereum was no longer hidden.
And adoption multiplied, for both rich and poor found a way to enter.
And the scribes wrote, “This is the fulfillment of prophecy: the nations bow to the covenant.”
And the people declared, “Blessed be the chain that was despised, yet is now exalted.”
Thus was the age of ETFs established, and the covenant sealed before kings and governors

chapters.title: The Rollup Prophecy and the Scaling of the Chain (27 verses)

verses.text: And the burden of scaling fell heavy upon the people, for gas devoured them without mercy.
And the cry went up, “Shall we not perish if this chain remaineth slow and costly?”
Then the prophets of rollups rose, speaking mysteries unto the assembly.
They said, “Lo, we shall build highways above the chain, that many may travel without burden.”
And they called them Optimistic and ZK, each walking a path of its own.
And the builders marveled, for they beheld proofs that bore witness without revealing.
Thus was trust preserved, yet speed increased.
And the skeptics spake, “How shall a chain dwell upon another chain?”
But the prophets answered, “As rivers flow into the sea, so do rollups return to Ethereum.”
And the covenant was not broken, for the root remained secure.
Then came bridges, binding realms together, but thieves lurked therein.
For in those days many were plundered, and billions vanished into the night.
And the people cried, “Shall we forever bleed from bridges?”
And the prophets replied, “Trust not the weak gates, but wait for the rollups to mature.”
And great tribes were born: Arbitrum, Optimism, zkSync, StarkNet, and many others.
Each contended for dominion, saying, “We are the chosen scaling.”
Yet the wise spake, “All roads return to the covenant, for Ethereum is the root.”
And Vitalik lifted his voice, declaring, “Rollups are the future ordained; let no man despise their youth.”
And he wrote scrolls of wisdom, guiding the builders in patience.
And adoption grew, for traders and gamers and scribes found refuge in the highways.
Thus gas was relieved, though not destroyed.
And hope was kindled in the hearts of the faithful.
Yet the prophets warned, “Scaling is not an end, but a journey.”
For each highway must prove its strength in fire.
And the people replied, “We shall watch and build, until the day of maturity.”
And the scribes recorded, “This is the rollup prophecy.”
And the covenant endured, stretching beyond its borders.

chapters.title: The DAO Reborn and the Spirit of Community (22 verses)

verses.text: And after many trials, the people remembered the wound of the first DAO, which was split in sorrow.
Yet the spirit of community revived, stronger than before.
For they said, “Shall one failure condemn the covenant? Nay, we shall rise again.”
And many DAOs were born: for treasuries, for art, for governance, for gaming.
Each gathered a multitude, who brought tokens as offerings of unity.
And decisions were made by votes, not kings, for power was shared.
Yet confusion abounded, for some DAOs were ruled by whales, and others by fools.
And prophets warned, “Governance is fragile; wield it with care.”
But the people rejoiced, saying, “At last, we have voices in matters once hidden.”
And great works were funded: protocols, cities, even ventures beyond the chain.
And scribes proclaimed, “The DAO is the parliament of the covenant.”
Yet thieves and jesters entered, and some DAOs fell to ruin.
And scoffers mocked, “DAOs are chaos, naught but mobs with tokens.”
But the faithful answered, “Even so, we learn and grow, for the spirit of community cannot die.”
And new forms emerged: service DAOs, investment DAOs, guilds of workers.
And they spake, “We are many, yet one body in the covenant.”
And Vitalik smiled, saying, “Governance is experiment, not perfection.”
And the people replied, “So be it; we shall refine.”
Thus the DAO was reborn, no longer a wound but a witness.
And the nations marveled, for power was diffused and shared.
And scribes recorded, “This is the spirit of the covenant: community above kings.”
And so it was sealed.

chapters.title: The DeFi Kingdoms and the Great Harvest (29 verses)

verses.text: And the covenant begat abundance, and men called it DeFi.
For protocols arose as fields of yield, and farmers entered with haste.
And they sowed tokens and reaped interest, as though money begat money.
And Uniswap was chief among them, a marketplace without gatekeepers.
And its pools overflowed with tokens, and traders rejoiced.
Then came Aave, lending and borrowing without masters.
And Compound followed, bringing forth interest in season.
And yield farms multiplied, as weeds in a field.
And many chased riches, not discerning the risk.
For APYs promised the stars, yet vanished as vapor.
And the wise warned, “Take heed, for unsustainable riches bring ruin.”
But the multitude heeded not, and many perished in rugs.
Yet others grew wealthy beyond measure, and their names were sung in the forums.
Then came Curve, a river of stablecoins, deep and enduring.
And Yearn, the harvester, which gathered yield for the lazy.
And protocols joined as legos, building towers of finance unseen.
And regulators trembled, crying, “This is an ungoverned kingdom; who shall oversee it?”
But the faithful answered, “It is code, and code obeyeth none but logic.”
Then arose exploits, draining vaults as locusts devour a field.
And fear spread, yet builders labored still.
For they said, “This is the frontier; wounds shall teach us wisdom.”
And some called DeFi a bubble, doomed to burst.
Yet others declared, “It is the future, though the path be perilous.”
And the covenant bore fruit in abundance, though storms struck often.
And scribes declared, “This is the great harvest.”
For from DeFi came liquidity unchained, beyond banks and borders.
And the people rejoiced, saying, “We are free to lend, borrow, and trade without masters.”
And even kings took notice, trembling at the loss of power.
Thus was DeFi established as a kingdom of plenty.

chapters.title: The Forks and the Testing of the Faithful (20 verses)

verses.text: And contention arose in the covenant, as brethren disagreed.
For some cried, “This path is righteous,” and others, “Nay, follow us instead.”
And thus forks were born, each claiming the mantle of truth.
First was the great schism of the DAO, birthing Ethereum Classic.
And some clung to the immutability of code, while others chose the path of restoration.
And bitterness endured for many years.
Then came other forks, in times of testing.
Some were noble experiments, others were vanity and greed.
And tokens multiplied, confusing the nations.
And scoffers mocked, saying, “Your covenant is divided; how can it stand?”
But the faithful answered, “Division testeth the heart, yet the root abideth.”
And some forks withered, forgotten by time.
Yet others thrived, becoming realms of their own.
And Vitalik spake, “Let every fork be judged by its fruits.”
And the people replied, “So shall it be.”
Thus forks became both blessing and curse, a trial for the faithful.
And scribes wrote, “These are the testing of Ethereum, to purge and refine.”
For unity is not always agreement, but covenant unbroken.
And though branches spread, the root endured.
Thus was faith preserved amid contention.

chapters.title: The Eternal Covenant and the Future Without End (25 verses)

verses.text: And after many seasons, the covenant was sealed anew, unbroken by wars, winters, or forks.
For Ethereum stood as a pillar among chains, tried and refined.
And the faithful gathered, declaring, “This is the eternal covenant.”
They spake, “It is not a coin only, but a civilization of code.”
For therein are markets, and art, and governance, and dreams unnumbered.
And nations could not silence it, nor kings bind it.
And the prophets declared, “Behold, the future is without end.”
For every season bringeth new visions, and builders arise as stars.
And Layer
And adoption spread unto the ends of the earth.
Merchants accepted, artists minted, and citizens governed.
And the covenant reached beyond finance, unto identity and knowledge.
For they said, “Let learning be on-chain, and credentials verifiable.”
And others spake, “Let culture be preserved, immutable as scripture.”
And so Ethereum became not only a network, but a library, a city, a nation of code.
And pilgrims from every land joined, bringing their works and wealth.
Yet the prophets warned, “Forget not the principles: openness, neutrality, and truth.”
For power, if seized, corrupteth; but the covenant, if guarded, endureth.
And scoffers still mocked, but their words fell idle.
For the chain had proven itself through fire uncounted.
And the faithful replied, “Though ETH falleth, it shall rise again; though mocked, it shall endure.”
And scribes declared, “This covenant is eternal, beyond nations and kings.”
And children yet unborn shall call upon it, building new worlds atop the old.
For the covenant hath no end, but passeth from generation to generation.
Thus was the book closed, yet the story without end.

library.book: The Chronicles Of The HODL Scriptures

verses.text: Patience is the seed from which fortunes spring, but haste is the wind that scatters gains to the void.
The impatient buy at the trumpet of euphoria, but the wise wait in silence when fear covers the land.
Do not uproot the tree because the fruit tarries, for in its season it yields more than gold.
He who refreshes his portfolio each hour finds torment; but he who sleeps on his bags wakes to peace.
The market is a stormy sea; the patient sailor endures, but the rash leaps into the waves and is swallowed.
When candles bleed red, patience is a cloak against despair; when they burn green, patience is a guard against pride.
Many mocked the hodler, yet in cycles past the hodler mocked them in return.
Patience is not idleness, but quiet labor while the harvest gathers unseen.
The fool asks, “When moon?” but the wise say, “Time is the ladder.”
Blessed is the one who holds through winter, for spring shall clothe him with abundance.
Do not trade the day for the promise of the age; for what is quick gain compared to enduring wealth?
Patience preserves conviction as salt preserves flesh.
Where impatience rules, regret follows close behind.
Even the seed of Ethereum lay hidden until it sprang forth; so wait for thy own season.
The cycles are many, but the patient walk through all.
Patience is the silent partner of faith; without her, hope withers.
Those who waited through fire were crowned with riches; those who fled at smoke returned too late.
Learn this: it is not the market that breaks the impatient, but their own restless spirit.
Be not quick to sell, nor hasty to boast; for time tests all things.
Thus patience is the mother of wealth, and her children are contentment and peace.
Greed builds towers of sand, and fear washes them away.
The greedy man counts candles as treasures, but wakes to ashes in his wallet.
Fear whispers, “Sell now, or be ruined”; greed shouts, “Buy more, or be left behind.”
Both are false prophets, leading many into folly.
He who is ruled by greed forgets his brother; he who is ruled by fear forgets himself.
Greed cries loudest at the top; fear speaks clearest at the bottom.
When all rejoice, ask thyself, “Who shall hold my bags?”
When all despair, ask thyself, “Whose treasure lies hidden here?”
Greed multiplies leverage until the house of cards falls; fear hoards stablecoins until they wither in purchasing power.
Greed boasts, “I will never sell”; fear weeps, “I have lost it all.”
But wisdom holds balance between them, neither exalting nor despairing.
He who takes profit too soon feeds fear; he who holds forever feeds greed.
Know thy portion, and thou shalt be content.
The greedy chase memecoins; the fearful flee from blue chips. Both stumble.
When greed blinds, even the plainest scam shines like a jewel.
When fear reigns, even solid stones seem like sinking sand.
Guard thy heart against these two beasts, for they devour without mercy.
Let discipline be thy lamp, and wisdom thy staff.
Riches gathered by greed fade as mist; riches preserved with wisdom endure.
He who conquers greed and fear shall be free, and his path shall be straight.
Remember: Greed and fear are twins; do not raise them in thy house.
For markets rise and fall, but character stands forever.
Hope is the fire that warms in the winter of bears.
Endurance is the road that carries thee to spring.
The hopeless sell in the night, but the hopeful keep their lamps burning.
Endurance is heavier than gold, but those who carry it find life.
The market beats down the faint, but lifts the steadfast.
He who endures one cycle earns wisdom; he who endures two earns wealth; he who endures three is unshakable.
Hope says, “This too shall pass”; fear says, “This is the end.”
Endurance laughs at fear, for it has walked through worse.
Hope plants seeds even when winter is long; endurance waters them until harvest.
Do not despise the years of endurance, for therein lies the strength of conviction.
The hopeful do not wander after every new chain; the enduring do not sell at every dip.
Hope builds communities, endurance builds legacies.
The prophets spake: “Bear markets are for builders.”
The wise replied: “Bear markets are for holders.”
Together they said: “Bear markets are for the enduring.”
Those who endure are remembered when the weak are forgotten.
Those who hope are honored when the doubters are silent.
Write this law: Hope is fuel, endurance is armor, and together they outlast all storms.
Many shall rise, saying, “Follow me, for I have alpha,” but their words are nets for the greedy.
False prophets wear avatars of apes and dogs, but their hearts are empty.
They promise tenfold returns, yet their wallets are already fleeing.
They cry, “This coin is the next Ethereum,” but the graveyards of tokens are full.
False prophets know the greed of men, and they feed it with charts and whispers.
They pump, they shill, they vanish.
He who trusts them shall weep; he who discerns shall rest.
Test every spirit: if it speaks only of gains, beware; if it speaks of vision and labor, consider.
Do not mistake clout for wisdom, nor followers for truth.
The greatest prophets spake sparingly, but the false cry daily.
False prophets flourish in bull runs, for the herd is blinded by green.
But in winter they are silent, leaving their flock in ruin.
Do not be as children, tossed to and fro by influencers.
Wisdom is slow, scams are quick.
Build where false prophets cannot destroy: on knowledge, on discipline, on conviction.
Remember: wolves wear sheep’s memes.
False prophets profit from your haste; true builders profit with your patience.
The market shall judge them all, and time shall reveal their end.
Therefore, guard thy purse, and lend thine ear only to the wise.
For fools follow false prophets, but the discerning walk free.
Wealth is no evil, nor poverty a curse, but the heart’s desire reveals the man.
Better is wisdom in poverty than folly in riches.
He who gains wealth by scams is rich for a moment, but poor forever.
Wealth without purpose is chains; wealth with vision is wings.
The poor in spirit chase every pump; the wealthy in wisdom choose their path.
Some who lost wealth gained wisdom; some who gained wealth lost soul.
Do not measure thy worth by tokens alone, for all charts return to dust.
Better to hold knowledge than memecoins; better to hold conviction than a thousand bags.
The poor envy the whale, but the whale envies the builder.
Wealth gathered slowly is strong; wealth gathered quickly is brittle.
Poverty teaches discipline; wealth tests humility.
Both are needed, for the cycle spares none.
He who hoards his wealth shall lose it; he who shares builds legacy.
Wealth multiplies when spread; poverty deepens when hidden.
The market gives, the market takes; blessed is the one who learns from both.
Some are poor yet boast as kings; some are rich yet hide as beggars.
True wealth is to endure the storm and still believe.
True poverty is to profit yet lose conviction.
Therefore seek wealth in wisdom, not only in coins.
For riches fade, but wisdom endures.
No one hodls alone, though his wallet be private.
The strength of one ape is little; the strength of many apes shakes the forest.
A shiller seeks profit, but a brother seeks your good.
Community is the net that catches the falling; without it, the fall is deadly.
Brotherhood is forged in red candles, not in green.
He who rejoices at another’s liquidation is no brother.
He who lends a hand in despair builds eternal bonds.
A whale without a tribe is a stranded beast; a shrimp with a family is mighty.
Discords and DAOs are but tools; the spirit of fellowship gives them power.
Betrayal within a community is worse than rugpulls.
But loyalty multiplies wealth even when tokens fail.
Community shelters the new, disciplines the reckless, and celebrates the wise.
Do not despise the small holder, for in unity even shrimps move markets.
Brotherhood endures beyond price; friendship holds when charts collapse.
To build alone is vanity; to build together is destiny.
The prophets were not lone voices, but surrounded by tribes that amplified their cry.
Guard thy community, for it is more precious than thy gains.
For scams fade, but true brotherhood remains.
One voice may be silenced, but a chorus cannot.
Therefore love thy brother as thy fellow hodler, for together ye are unshaken.
Builders lay bricks in silence while traders chase noise.
Dreamers see the city yet to come; builders lay its foundations.
The market mocks them in winter, yet crowns them in summer.
Blessed are the builders, for they plant seeds others shall harvest.
The dreamer speaks of visions; the builder writes code. Both are needed.
Without dreamers, builders wander; without builders, dreamers lie idle.
The bull praises traders, but the bear reveals builders.
Many boast of being early; only builders make early real.
The memecoin dies; the protocol endures.
Traders chase pumps, but builders create ladders.
Dreamers kindle hope, but builders keep it alive.
The prophets said, “Bear markets are for builders.”
Indeed, every great city rose from ashes.
The wise know this: code is law, but vision is covenant.
Builders labor unseen, yet their works testify.
Dreamers see the impossible, and builders make it flesh.
